channel.title: CDC Flu updates
channel.description: An RSS feed of new postings to the CDC flu site.

item.title: U.S. Flu Activity Report - Week Ending December 12, 2009 (Week 49)
item.description: Latest information on influenza activity in the United States.

item.title: U.S. Flu Activity Report - Week Ending December 5, 2009 (Week 48)
item.description: Latest information on influenza activity in the United States.

item.title: Children should get the 2009 H1N1 flu vaccine
item.description: Most children who get 2009 H1N1 flu feel better within a week. Other children get very sick. Some even have a hospital stay, and some die. Children who get vaccinated are less likely to get the flu.

item.title: Flyer: Protect yourself from H1N1.
item.description: Individual flyers for African American, Asian and Pacific Islander, American Indian and Alaska Native, and multicultural audiences

item.title: Flyer: You and the H1N1 flu vaccine.
item.description: The 2009 H1N1 vaccine is made the same way as seasonal flu vaccines. Millions of seasonal flu vaccines have been given safely. Millions of people have also safely received the 2009 H1N1 vaccine.

item.title: Flyer: Cover Your Cough: Stop the Spread of Germs that Make You and Others Sick!
item.description: Guidance flyer for covering your cough to protect yourself and others.

item.title: U.S. Flu Activity Report - Week Ending November 28, 2009 (Week 47)
item.description: Latest information on influenza activity in the United States.

item.title: Influenza A (H1N1) 2009 Monovalent Vaccine Dosage Chart
item.description: Influenza A (H1N1) 2009 Monovalent Vaccine Dosage Chart: Information on the Inactivated, Injectable Influenza Vaccine

item.title: Vaccine Storage and Handling Q&A
item.description: The purpose of this document is to provide information to vaccine planners, clinicians and health care providers on the storage, preparation, and handling of inactivated and live attenuated (LAIV) influenza A (H1N1) 2009 monovalent vaccine.

item.title: U.S. Flu Activity Report - Week Ending November 21, 2009 (Week 46)
item.description: Latest information on influenza activity in the United States.

item.title: U.S. Flu Activity Report - Week Ending November 14, 2009 (Week 45)
item.description: Latest information on influenza activity in the United States.

item.title: National Influenza Vaccination Week
item.description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) will soon announce dates for National Influenza Vaccination Week. This event is designed to highlight the importance of continuing influenza (flu) vaccination, as well as foster greater use of flu vaccine through the months of December, January and beyond.
